lines.text: [repeated line]
SSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSMOKIN'!
[after being shot]
Hold me closer, Ed, it's getting dark.
[cough, cough]
Tell Auntie Em to let Old Yeller out.
[cough cough]
Tell Tiny Tim I won't be coming home this Christmas
[cough, cough]
Tell Scarlett I do give a damn.
[coughs in Orlando's face, raspberries, then farts]
Pardon me.
[he dies, the Peanut Gallery appears and applauds while The Mask is handed an acting award]
Thank you, you love me, you really love me!

[to Tina]
Kiss me, my dear, and I will reveal my croissant. I will spread your pate. I will dip my ladle in your vichyssoise.
[Tina kicks him and scampers away]

[squeaky voice]
She is so coy.
[deep voice]
I love it!

[standing in front of a mirror, in the process of going out to a club]
It's party time. P, A, R, T. Y? Because I gotta!
Ooh, somebody stop me!
Ipkiss! Police! Freeze!
[the Mask freezes in mid-air]
Put your hands up.

[his teeth are frozen together]
But you told me to freeze!
All right, all right. Un-freeze.
[the Mask un-freezes and falls to the ground]
You're under arrest.
[pulls out his cuffs]
No! It wasn't me! It was the One-Armed Man!
[regular voice]
All right, I confess! I did it, ya hear? And I'm glad! GLAD, I TELL YA!
[gets down on his knees and puts his hands up together]
What are they gonna do to me, Sarg.? WHAT ARE THEY GONNA DO?

[puts the cuffs on The Mask's wrists]
Sorry, son. That's not my department. Search him.

[the cops bring The Mask to his feet]
Ow! Where's a cam-corder when you need one?
[snorts in laughter]
Really big sunglasses.
Bike horn.
Small mouth bass
Bowling Pin

[Yells in pain]
Mouse Trap.
Rubber Chicken.
A little to the left... that's it.

[squeezes a stress releaver toy a few times]
mmmm, I don't know. Funny eyeball glasses?
I've never seen those before in my life.
Bazooka?
I have a permit for that.

[going through The Mask's pocket]
Picture of Kellaway's wife.
What?
Uh-oh.
Margaret!
Geez I thought you would have a sense of humor. After all - you married her!
[slaps both Kellaway and Doyle in the face repeatedly]
That's gotta hurt.
Get'em!
[looks down to see his and Doyles wristes are handcuffed to eachother]
Doyle!
Our love is like a red, red rose... and I am a little thorny.
[in a thick French accent]
Hello, Cherie. We meet again. Is it fate? Is it meant to be? Is it written in the stars that we are destined to fraternize?
[Normal voice]
I'd like to think so. Ha, ha ha!
Okay, Twinkle Toes. I want to know where my money is, and I want to know right now.
Okay
[sits on stool and takes out an adding machine]
You've got 17.5% in T-bills amortized over the fiscal year, 8% in stocks and bonds. Carry the 9, divide by the Gross National Product... fortunately, funeral bouquets are deductible.

[to henchman]
Ice this deadbeat!
[the Mask pulls out his guns and aims them at Dorian's henchman]

[In Clint Eastwood voice]
You gotta ask yourself one question. "Do I feel lucky?" Well, do ya? Punks!
[a bomb has just exploded inside The Mask, leading to a fiery belch]

[With Italian accent]
THAT'S A SPICY MEATBALL!
Hey, mister! You got the time?
As a matter of fact I do, Cubby.
[pulls out a wind up alarm clock]
LOOK AT THAT! It's exactly two seconds before I honk your nose and pull your underwear over your head!
Je t'adore. Je t'window. I don't care!
Hold on, Sugar! Daddy's got a sweet tooth tonight!

[to get his dog to steal the keys from the sleeping guard]
No Milo, not the *cheese*... The *keys*!
[Pulls out a condom in front of a bunch of thugs]
Sorry, wrong pocket.
Somebody STOLE your pajamas?

[seeing Milo jump at the closet door where the stolen money is]
Milo, no! I mean, uh, what is this world coming to when a man's... *pajama drawer* is no longer safe?
[last lines]

[on a bridge with Tina, holding the mask in his hand]
You sure you're not gonna miss this guy? Once he's gone, all that's left is me.

[Without a word, Tina takes it from him and throws it into the water, then grabs and kisses him. Meanwhile, Charlie, watching them, gets out of the car and rushes over to the edge of the bridge to look for the mask. It's floating in the water, so he climbs over the railing and jumps in... ]

[seeing Milo swimming off with the mask]
MILO!
[Meanwhile... ]

[a wide grin on his face]
SSSMOKIN'!
[He grabs Tina and kisses her... ]
Ipkiss, do you have any idea what time it is?
Actually, no.

[spots his wet feet on her carpet]
My new carpet! Well, this is coming right out of your security deposit, Ipkiss!
You know, Mrs. Peenman...
What?

[dejectedly]
Nothing.
Well, that's what you are, Ipkiss, a big nothing!

[after Mrs. Peenman slams her door]
Aren't you due back at the lab to have your bolts tightened?

[to Dorian, with Eddie G. Robinson's voice]
You were good, kid, real good. But as long as I'm around, you'll always be second best, see?
It's a power tie. It's supposed to make you feel powerful.
Does it work?

[knowing it doesn't work, tries changing the subject]
Now, uh, how about that account? We have...
[nervously jams a pen in the pencil sharpener, making a loud grinding noise]
checking, savings and checking, CDs, savings and CDs, checking and CDs, savings, checking, and CDs, T-bills, or we can just take all your money and throw it in a big mattress back there.
Ipkiss, we have a crisis on our hands here and you stroll in over an hour late? If I have to put up with your slovenly behavior...

BACK OFF, Monkey Boy, before I tell your daddy you're running this place like it's your own personal piggy bank. Or maybe we should call the IRS, and see if we can arrange a little vacation for you at Club FED!

[shocked from being told off by his employee]
That'll be all, Ipkiss.
[Thugs shoot at the Mask]
Did you miss me?
[Takes a drink, and the liquid pours out through holes in his body]
I GUESS NOT!
Bigger Better Deal.
You don't know that, Charlie. She's an artist. She's... she's sensitive.

Stanley, forget her. That girl will tear your heart out, put it in a blender and hit "frappe." You don't need her, man. You need somebody a little more down to earth. Somebody with some integrity. Somebody with
[sees Peggy]
red hair and full pouty lips, a white blouse, a green jacket and a name tag.
Boy, you really narrowed it down.
We all wear masks... metaphorically speaking.

[Flattened from landing on the street]
Look Ma, I'm roadkill!
You were good kid, real good. But as long as I'm around, you'll always be second best, see?
Do you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.
The money better be here, Ipkiss. Or you're gonna "Ipkiss" your ass goodbye.
Ladies and Gentlemen, I will be your host for the remainder of the evening.
Stanley, you are the nicest guy. Really, you are.
Yeah?
Charlie, isn't Stanley the nicest guy?
The best.
[Maggie walks off]
That was THE most sickening display I've ever seen.
I disagree. I think I'm wearing her down.

[taking out car part]
Hey, Burt, what the hell is this?
Oh, I don't know, about seven hundred bucks, Irv?

[imitating Dr. Neuman]
That's correct, Wendy. We all wear masks, metaphorically speaking.
[Stanley laughs, puts on mask, it starts to suck on his face and he pulls it off]

[bewildered]
Yeah, right.
Ipkiss? Stanley Ipkiss?
Yes?
Lt. Kellaway, city precinct. You know anything about the disturbance last night?
Dis... turbance?
Yeah, some kind of prowler broke in and attacked Mrs. Peenman.
Attacked?
You didn't hear anything? She unloaded a couple of rounds of buckshot 5 feet from your door.
[Stanley sees Mrs. Peenman complaining about big hole in floor]
This is... impossible.
Those pajamas are impossible. This actually happened.
See, I have an inner ear problem. Sometimes I can't hear anything.
Is that a fact?
Eh?
[laughs]
Here's my card. If you remember anything unusual about last night, anything at all, call me.
You betcha. Thank you. And good luck... cracking the case.
I'm with the Evening Star. Can you tell me what happened here?
No, and you can quote me.
Well, it looks like some sort of Mob tactic.
There it is, boys, she broke the case. Come on, get these rubbernecks out of here.
Uh, are you on the list?
Noooo. But I believe my friends are. Perhaps you know them.
[He takes fistfuls of high denomination cash out of his pocket]
Franklin, Grant, and... Jackson?
[Tyrell and Ipkiss are fighting at the club]
I'm gonna take you apart.
Well, I hope you can enjoy the victory with one freakin' eye!
[Ipkiss pokes Tyrell in the eye]
I want to see you in my office first thing tomorrow morning.
Yes, your honor.
That doesn't sound good at all.

[Sarcastically]
No, it doesn't sound good. What would sound good to you?
Breakfast!
SHUT UP!

[about to attack the mechanics who cheated him earlier]
Hold on to your lugnuts, it's tiiiiime for an overhaul!

[to a wounded Freeze]
What happened?
Someone hit the joint before we could.

[Places a cigarette in Freeze's mouth]
Here, suck on that.
[Tries to light his lighter, but Freeze dies and the cigarette falls out of his mouth]
[looking angrilly]
[Throws the cigarette lighter across the bar room where it crashes and breaks something]

[after falling out an apartment window, the Mask pulls his head out of the ground and faces the camera]
Look, Ma! I'm road kill! Ha, ha, ha!
Can't make the scene if you don't have the green.
IPKISS! You're 40 minutes late. Now that's the same as stealing!

[after Stanley snaps at Dickey]
Genius. That was genius. Buddy, I have chills! What side of whose bed did you wake up on, man?

[On Stanley's mismatched pajamas]
There can't be two idiots with pajamas like these.
This party's over
[bends down to time bomb]
in 10 minutes.
[starts time bomb]

[looking wistfully at the newspaper clipping of Tina]
Stupid. She would never...
[He turns and sees the mask lying on the sofa. Slowly, he walks over to it and holds it... ]

[throwing it over the sofa]
No way.
[Walks away, stops, then jumps back over the sofa and puts it on]
The Coco Bongo Club. Hottest new joint in town. Only the creme de la creme need apply.
So how do we get in?
I'm here for the Civic.
The brake drums are shot and you need a new transmission.
What? All I wanted was an oil change!
Well, you're lucky we caught these problems now before they cause you some serious trouble.

[Being lifted by bodyguards]
You put me down, or I am never coming back here!
[They drop him on the ground painfully]

[Weak with pain]
Thanks.

[after Mr. Dickey leaves]
Gee, I wish MY daddy owned a bank. Then I could be a rich little creep too.
Hi, I'm Peggy Brandt from the Tribune.
Oh, hi. Look, I cancelled my subscription because they kept stealing my paper from the...
Oh, no, actually, I just want to ask you a few questions.
Really? About what?
Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs, aren't you?
Me? No. I don't even have a car. You know, 'cause they pollute.
You don't own an '89 Civic?
Oh, that car, yeah. Yeah. It's all coming back to me.
Drop it, Tyrell!
Hey, Kellaway!
Drop it!
A'right.
[drops gun]
So, you got a warrant this time? Or'd you just stop by for a nightcap?
What I got is probable cause. A couple of your boys was spotted knocking over Edge City Bank.

[to Doyle]
Easy, junior, you're giving me a Woody.
And one of 'em was wearing a big green mask.
You know, for once, Kellaway, you're right. Except it wasn't one of my boys. Maybe if you tried a little actual police work...

[to policemen]
Cuff 'em.
Hey, lieutenant, we got a stiff upstairs. It's one of the guys from the heist.
Better call that high-priced lawyer of yours, Tyrell. You and I are going downtown for a little chat. Get him out of here!

[Spots a piece of Stanley's pajamas on floor]
Ipkiss!

[to Kellaway]
Hi, lieutenant. Listen, this isn't the best time right now for a...
[Kellaway enters]
Won't you come in?

50 grand. 50 grand to the man who finds that green-faced son of a bitch before the cops do. I want you to get the word out to every street hustler, to every lowlife in this town, you understand? I want him here tomorrow, alive.
And now, like Napoleon, I will divide and conquer.
[about to kiss Tina]
Ipkiss! Police!
Merde.

[Reffering to the mask, which Stanley brought in]
I'm talking about the mythology, Mr. Ipkiss. This is a piece of wood.
Stanley! Tell me. How's this mask work?
I don't know. You just put it on.
[Dorian is about to put on the mask]
Boss! You better be carefull, huh?
[Dorian puts on the mask and transforms himself into The Mask]

[now in deepend voice]
What a rush!
Wow, boss! You're okay?
Better than ever, you idiot.
What do we do with Ipkiss?
The police are looking for The Mask. So, we'll give them The Mask.

[explaining how The Mask works]
It's like it brings your innermost desires to life. If deep down you're a little repressed, and a hopeless romantic, you become some kind of love-crazy wild man.
And if you're someone like Dorian?
Then we're all in big trouble.
Stanley? Are you all right?
Yeah. I've, never been better, really. Just... Just catching some air out here.
a loaner Studebaker]
Your car, sir.

[chuckles to Tina]
That's not my car.
It matches the ticket.
All right... I'll take it. But I am VERY angry. You believe this? You drive in in a Porsche...
I do have one question.
Which is?
What does Niko have to say about this?
Nothin'... this ain't his grift.
Get real man, everything is his grift. He owns you, he owns this... club he owns this whole stink' town.
Things change
[takes drag on cigarette]
You mess with Niko you end up takin' a dirt nap.
I missed 'em.
C'mon... we all missed 'em.

[Tina's being chased by one of Dorian's henchmen]
Hey, guard, there's a woman being chased in the alley there.
Yeah, yeah, yeah. Keep it down.
C'mon, MAN! SERVE AND PROTECT!
Thanks.
For what?
Lots of things. Sharing the sunset with me. For being the only guy whose ever treated me like a person and not some sort of party favor. For being any kind of romantic. Even a hopeless one.
You're welcome.
You know that night at the club? I knew I'd found someone special.

[rolls his eyes]
The Mask.
No, it was the guy inside the mask. It was you all along. You, Stanley Ip... kiss.
[they go to kiss when the guard interrupts them]

[Niko hits a golf ball, it lands in a virtual reality golf game screen]
120 yards.
[Dorian enters with 2 of Niko's men on each side]
Hello, Dorian. Thanks for dropping by.
Well, next time why don't you call, all right? Leave the delivery boys at home.

[Niko grins at the thugs evilly and nods. They force Dorian to the floor, and Niko laughs as they do. One of them points a gun at Dorian and the other places a wooden tee in Dorian's mouth. He spits the tee out. The man with the gun cocks the hammer and holds the gun to Dorian's head. The other man then places another tee in Dorian's mouth and puts a golf ball on it]

[swings club slowly around Dorian's face]
The cops, ah... tried to shut the club down this morning. They say you've been using the place to run your own small-time scams. I hear things like that, and I start losing my concentration. And my game, it goes straight to HELL!
[pulls the club back for swing]
You could, too.
[swings and hits the ball]

[cries out in pain]
Ahh!
205 yards.
I'm fed up with you, Dorian. But I'm gonna cut you a break. One week to get out of town.
[brushing Dorian's cheek with the club. Dorian smacks it away]
After that, I'll use your empty little skull to break in my new 9-iron.
[the two thugs lift Dorian up roughly and escort him out of office]

[opens the door]
Hi, Lieutenant. This isn't a good time right now, so...
[Kellaway enters]
Won't you come in?
Where were you last night, Ipkiss?
Here, mostly. Is something wrong?
What do you know about this Mask character?

[chuckles]
Mask?
Don't insult my intelligence, Ipkiss. He robs the bank you work in and then I find this in the Coco Bongo.
[shows Stanley a piece of his pajamas]
There can't be 2 idiots with pajamas like these.
[Milo is trying to open the door to the closet where the money is stashed away]
Milo, no!
May I see those pajamas, Mr. Ipkiss?
Those, uh, those pajamas were, uh... stolen.
Somebody stole your pajamas?

[grabs Milo]
Yeah. I mean, what is the city coming to when a man's pajama drawer is no longer safe?
[after Stanley defeats Dorian, Charlie runs in with police reinforcements]
Officers, arrest those men! I always wanted to say that.

[banging on his door]
Ipkiss, turn down those cartoons!
All right, Mrs. PeenMAN!
You got any pickle relish?
Doyle, get in the car.
But I ordered onion rings.
Doyle!

[about Dorian, with the mask]
He's going to the charity ball tonight. He's gonna do something terrible.
Like what, the Lambada?
[Kellaway and Doyle climb over the park wall, to find the Mask leading a big dance number; Doyle tries to join in]

[Grabbing Doyle by the arm]
Start dancing, and I'll blow your brains out!

[as Dorian's henchmen drag Stanley to a newpaper printing machine]
You said you wouldn't hurt him!
I lied.

[Stanley tries to catch up with Charlie at the club]
You crossed the rope. NEVER cross the rope.
Milo stay here. Looks like Daddy's gotta go kick some butt.
[Repeated line]

[Sternly]
*Doyle*
It's all over, Ipkiss - put your hands over your head or we'll open fire!
